messages: 1f46358417f408b3aef79f6702c708fd (19:53): kde4 on windows work has started and so is Gnome on windows, Does it has any implications on reactos ?
e8cb5d78731d0b117f529734f7c2d6a4 (19:53): i dont think so
6443589cd7e633525406da5c5bfae151 (20:00): kde4 on windows?
1f46358417f408b3aef79f6702c708fd (20:04): yes, the work has started, i will just give u link,
1f46358417f408b3aef79f6702c708fd (20:05): http://www.kdelibs.com/
250b62f8c821ff3712fadca5aebd19fd (20:15): kde4 on windows, or kde4 on cygwin? (two different things)
7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:18): asfak: they might prove to be interesting testcases, but ROS is very much developed from a Windows perspective
3e5c430d871870351b224a9023721ddb (20:18): asfak: elaborate on 'implications' ?
7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:19): that is, you shouldn't expect to see foreign widget sets and libs become part of ROS

7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:20): to the extent that code from Unix-oriented projects is used, it's code that implements interfaces and standards that would be expected in a native Windows environment (e.g. samba for SMB, Mesa for OpenGL)

1f46358417f408b3aef79f6702c708fd (20:30): Mr Ged, i am non-techie, Implications means, if in near future kde4 application and desktop is ported to windows, and gets compatible with reactos (if possible) we would get great many software like K3b and others on reactos.
7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:31): Zhila: Windows, judging by the build instructions
3e5c430d871870351b224a9023721ddb (20:32): asfak: when it runs on Windows, it will run on ReactOS
7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:32): asfak: If someone makes the effort to port it to Windows, I don't see why not...
7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:33): cdrdao and cdrtools have Windows ports, although I'm not sure whether they're native
1f46358417f408b3aef79f6702c708fd (20:34): yes, it has started, look here, http://www.kdelibs.com/wiki/index.php/Status

7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:34): there is actually already a Windows cdrdao/cdrtools frontend called BurnAtOnce, although that's not quite as glossy as K3b and the license is a bit questionable

7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:36): asfak: I meant whether someone will port K3b to Windows after KDE is ported; for something like a CD burning app there are likely much deeper considerations than just GUI toolkit and desktop environment
7e79a68e4f97d75ae6176c9b1e8aa733 (20:36): even if the bulk of the backend tools are already ported
1f46358417f408b3aef79f6702c708fd (20:39): yeah, i agree, esp gtk based..
